body: 81 (return) [ Jerom himself is forced to allow, crudelissim¾ interfectiones diversi sexžs perpetrat¾, (in Chron. p. 186.) But an original _libel_, or petition of two presbyters of the adverse party, has unaccountably escaped. They affirm that the doors of the Basilica were burnt, and that the roof was untiled; that Damasus marched at the head of his own clergy, grave-diggers, charioteers, and hired gladiators; that none of _his_ party were killed, but that one hundred and sixty dead bodies were found. This petition is published by the P. Sirmond, in the first volume of his work.]
